result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Marshall Rzepinski

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Shane Marshall Rzepinski not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Stip was sent out second time to be returned within a week.  Def FTA so Court prepared to default.  Court reschedules for future date with def to be defaulted if FTA on citations, and warrant will be issued in criminal case.  Case scheduled for 11/14 at 10:15 a.m.  Adj.  10:24 a.m.  klr
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:10 AM Defendant Shane Marshall Rzepinski not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case.  Stip has been sent out, but def failed to return.  Court defaults for amount listed on citations.  60 DTP.  Adj.  9:23 a.m.  klr

ADDRESS INFO for Shane Marshall Rzepinski
Current: P.O. Box 194, Odanah, WI 54861 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2022)
Prior: 613 Vaughn Ave, Ashland, WI 54806

10:35 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears via phone.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Stip wasn't returned.  Def states was out of town.  Stipulation to be sent this week and returned by def within a week.  Adj.  10:37 a.m.  klr
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:41 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears via phone.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court explains charges and penalties.  Def pleads NG.  PTC to be set for 5/18 at 8:45 a.m.  TR's to track with criminal case.  Adj.  9:44 a.m.  klr
Initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:26 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def fails to appear.  Court then calls 22TR332 and 333.  Court deems FTA in TR cases as a NC plea and imposes fine as on citations.  Gives def 60 days to pay.  Court adjourns criminal case for DA to address.  Case to be set for 5/16 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  9:30 a.m.  klr
